intro: Maytenus mossambicensis var. rubra, commonly known as the red mayten, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its reddish-brown bark and elliptical leaves that are often tinged with red or purple. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by orange-red berries that are an important food source for various wildlife. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is adapted to well-drained, sandy soils. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
